3e99bbfa073249d49c222ba61a9a4817.text: I am, however, going to urge you to talk about this, and your anxiety in general, with a medical professional. Anxiety is bad enough, but it can also affect your perspective on people and events. It's possible that your responses to these people have been amplified by the anxiety, but you're not able to recognize it. Talking to an unrelated third party can help sort it out.

- Challenge negative thoughts: When you have negative thoughts about yourself, challenge them by asking yourself if they are really true. Often, our thoughts can be distorted and not based on reality.
